description: One-minute skill: Harry Potter: The Witchcraft Panic.

buildup.text: J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series topped banned book lists throughout the 2000s in the United States.

discovery.text: Religious groups argued the books taught children real magic and led them away from Christianity.

twist.text: A Catholic school in Tennessee banned the series in 2019, claiming the spells were 'actual curses.'

climax.text: The books sold over 500 million copies worldwide â€” the bans only fueled children's desire to read them.

punchline.text: They tried to ban magic. They made reading magical.
